batterychargermain-working.c

Go to the documentation of this file.
00001 /*
00002 @mainpage Solar Regulator Project Embedded Atmel AVR module
00003 @version 0.0.1
00004 @author Ken Sarkies (www.jiggerjuice.net)
00005 @date 30 October 2009
00006 @brief Code for the embedded portion of the Solar Regulator Project,
00007 for the Atmel MCU ATMega88 or ATMega168
00008 
00009 This is a test version to check battery operation.
00010 
00011 @note
00012 Software: AVR-GCC 1:4.2.2-1
00013 @note
00014 Target:   ATMega AVR with UART, I2C and ADC functions
00015 @note
00016 Tested:   ATMega48, ATMega88, ATMega168 at 8MHz, using UART, TWI, ADC.
00017 @note
00018 Uses:     UART library of Peter Fleury, NARTOS scheduling operating system
00019           library, TWI library, ADC library, Timer library.
00020  */
00021

00044 #include <inttypes.h>

00060 #define TRUE 1
00061 #define FALSE 0
00062 /* Convenience macros (we don't use them all) */
00063 #define  _BV(bit) (1 << (bit))
00064 #define  inb(sfr) _SFR_BYTE(sfr)
00065 #define  inw(sfr) _SFR_WORD(sfr)
00066 #define  outb(sfr, val) (_SFR_BYTE(sfr) = (val))
00067 #define  outw(sfr, val) (_SFR_WORD(sfr) = (val))
00068 #define  cbi(sfr, bit) (_SFR_BYTE(sfr) &= ~_BV(bit))
00069 #define  sbi(sfr, bit) (_SFR_BYTE(sfr) |= _BV(bit))
00070 #define  high(x) ((uint8_t) (x >> 8) & 0xFF)
00071 #define  low(x) ((uint8_t) (x & 0xFF))

00073 /*****************************************************************************/
00079 volatile union timeUnion
00080 {
00081     volatile uint32_t timeValue;
00082     volatile uint8_t  timeByte[4];
00083 } time;
00084 
00085 /*****************************************************************************/
00091     volatile uint16_t controlDelayCounter = 0;
00092     volatile uint16_t controlTaskCounter = 0;
00093     volatile uint16_t controlInterval = 0;
00094     volatile uint16_t displayDelayCounter = 0;
00095     volatile uint16_t displayTaskCounter = 0;
00096     volatile uint16_t displayInterval = 0;
00097     volatile uint16_t measurementTaskCounter = 0;
00098     volatile uint16_t measurementInterval = 0;

00102 /* Global Variables */
00105     volatile uint16_t uartInput;   
00106     volatile uint8_t lastError;    
00107     volatile uint8_t checkSum;     
00111     volatile uint8_t packetInState;   
00112     volatile uint8_t numberInBytes;   
00113     volatile uint8_t dataInByteCount; 
00114     volatile uint8_t inputCommand;    
00115     volatile uint8_t inputBuffer[DATA_BUFFER_SIZE]; 
00119     volatile uint8_t outputBusy;      
00120     volatile uint8_t packetOutState;  
00121     volatile uint8_t numberOutBytes;  
00122     volatile uint8_t dataOutByteCount;
00123     volatile uint8_t outputCommand;   
00124     volatile uint8_t outputBuffer[DATA_BUFFER_SIZE]; 
00128     volatile uint8_t inputPacketReceiveID;
00129     volatile uint8_t outputPacketSendID;
00130     volatile uint8_t processCommandID;
00131     volatile uint8_t processErrorID;
00132     volatile uint8_t initiateControlTaskID;
00133     volatile uint8_t controlTaskID;
00134     volatile uint8_t measurementTaskID;
00135     volatile uint8_t displayTaskID;

00140     const    uint8_t  *address;

00143     volatile uint16_t bufferStartPointer=BUFFER_START;
00144     volatile uint16_t bufferEndPointer=BUFFER_START;  
00145     volatile uint16_t newBufferEndPointer;
00146     volatile uint8_t  shift;
00147     volatile uint16_t numberConversions;

00155     volatile uint16_t channelValue[4];

00158 /****************************************************************************/
00161 int main(void)
00162 {
00164     wdt_disable();                  /* Stop watchdog timer */
00165     setErrorCode(0);                /* Turn off error messages */
00167     if (eeprom_read_byte((uint8_t *)0) == 0xFF)     /* If unprogrammed, use defaults */
00168     {
00169         rtcScale = RTC_SCALE;           /* Tick period for RTC */
00170         localEEPROMDevice = LOCAL_EEPROM_DEVICE;        /* Address of EEPROM on I2C bus */
00171         eepromEnd = EEPROM_END;     /* Last address of EEPROM */
00172     }
00173     else
00174     {
00175         rtcScale = eeprom_read_byte((uint8_t *)15);
00176         localEEPROMDevice = eeprom_read_byte((uint8_t *)14);
00177         eepromEnd = eeprom_read_word((uint16_t *)12);
00178     }
00179 
00181     configurePorts();
00182     openPanel();
00183     connectLoad();
00184     adcInit(ADC_MODE,ADC_SPEED);
00185     twiInit(TWI_SPEED);
00186     InitLCD(0x00);
00187     time.timeValue = 0;
00188     timer0Init(0,rtcScale);
00189 
00192     uart_init(BAUDRATE);
00193 
00195     sei();
00196 
00198     lastError = NO_ERROR;
00199     packetInState = IDLE;       /* state for packet input state machine */
00200     packetOutState = IDLE;      /* state for packet transmission state machine */
00201     outputCommand = NO_COMMAND; /* command for transmission */
00202     outputBusy = FALSE;
00203 
00206     initNartos();
00207     inputPacketReceiveID = taskStart((uint16_t)*inputPacketReceive,FALSE);
00208     initiateControlTaskID = taskStart((uint16_t)*initiateControlTask,FALSE);
00209     LCDClear();
00210     LCDWriteString("Solar Power");
00211     LCDGotoXY(0,1);                         /* Next Line */
00212     LCDWriteString("Regulator V0.0");
00213     nartos();
00214 }
00215 
00216 /****************************************************************************/
00224 void initiateControlTask(void)
00225 {
00230     while (twiErrorStatus() == 0xFF) taskRelinquish();
00231     twiSetupTransaction(0);                 /* Write only */
00232     twiWriteByte(0);                        /* High EEPROM address */
00233     twiWriteByte(0);                        /* Low EEPROM address */
00234     bufferStartPointer = BUFFER_START;
00235     bufferEndPointer = bufferStartPointer;
00236     twiWriteByte(low(bufferStartPointer));  /* Start Pointer */
00237     twiWriteByte(high(bufferStartPointer));
00238     twiWriteByte(low(bufferEndPointer));    /* End Pointer */
00239     twiWriteByte(high(bufferEndPointer));
00240     if (twiLaunch(localEEPROMDevice))       /* device number */
00241     {
00242         while (twiErrorStatus() == 0xFF) taskRelinquish();
00243         uint8_t lastTwiError = twiErrorStatus();
00244         if (lastTwiError != 0) setErrorCode(WRITE_EEPROM_FAIL);
00245     }
00246     else
00247         setErrorCode(WRITE_EEPROM_FAIL);
00248 /* Set some defaults that will be parameters later */
00249     adcShift = 5;
00250 /* The control task runs at intervals restarted by the timer ISR.
00251 Set timer going once per minute */
00252 //    controlInterval = 60;
00253 //    controlTaskCounter = controlInterval;
00254     controlDelayCounter = 0;
00255     controlTaskID = taskStart((uint16_t)*controlTask,FALSE);
00256 /* The measurement task runs at intervals restarted by the timer ISR.
00257 Set timer going once per second */
00258 //    measurementInterval = 120;               /* 1 second ticks of measurement task */
00259 //    measurementTaskCounter = measurementInterval;
00260 //    measurementTaskID = taskStart((uint16_t)*measurementTask,FALSE);
00261 /* The display task runs at intervals restarted by the timer ISR.
00262 Set timer going three times per second */
00263     displayInterval = 30;                   /* 300ms ticks of measurement task */
00264     displayTaskCounter = displayInterval;
00265     displayTaskID = taskStart((uint16_t)*displayTask,FALSE);
00266     taskExit();
00267 }
00268 
00269 /****************************************************************************/
00276 void measurementTask(void)
00277 {
00278 /* Check that all channels are defined and get the necessary scale factors.
00279 This needs to happen regularly in case the EEPROM data is changed, so we do
00280 this every time.*/
00281     uint8_t numberChannels = eeprom_read_byte((uint8_t *)16);
00282     if (numberChannels > 4) numberChannels = 4;
00283     uint8_t channelStart = 2+eeprom_read_byte((uint8_t *)1);
00284     for (uint8_t channel = 0; channel < numberChannels; channel++)
00285     {
00286 /* Compute the number of averaging iterations. Note that the channel sums
00287 are maintained as 32 bit values so we can average quite aggressively */
00288         uint16_t sampleCount = (1 << adcShift);
00289 /* Fire off the A/D Conversions on both channels as enabled */
00290         uint32_t channelSum = 0;                    /* cumulative sums */
00291         uint16_t adcErrorCount = 0;                 /* Keep track of errored values */
00292         for (uint16_t n = 0; n < sampleCount; ++n)
00293         {
00298             if(adcStart(_BV(channel)))
00299             {
00300                 int adcValue = 0;
00301                 do
00302                 {
00303                     taskRelinquish();
00304                     adcValue = adcRead(channel);      /* Check if finished and grab result */
00305                 }
00306                 while (adcValue < 0);
00307                 uint16_t channelLastValue = adcValue;
00308                 channelSum += channelLastValue;
00309                 if (adcErrorCount > 0)
00310                 {
00311                     for (uint8_t i = 0; i < adcErrorCount; ++i)
00312                         channelSum += channelLastValue;
00313                     adcErrorCount = 0;
00314                 }
00315             }
00316             else adcErrorCount++;
00317         }
00319         channelValue[channel] = (channelSum >> adcShift);
00321         uint16_t channelMulScale = eeprom_read_word((uint16_t *)(channelStart+6));
00322         uint16_t channelOffScale = eeprom_read_word((uint16_t *)(channelStart+8));
00323         scaledChannelValue[channel] = rescale(channelValue[channel],channelMulScale,channelOffScale);
00324 /* Find the next channel information block. */
00325         channelStart = channelStart+eeprom_read_byte((uint8_t *)(channelStart+0))+1;
00326     }
00327 
00328 /* Reschedule the control task and quit */
00329     taskSchedule(controlTaskID,FALSE);
00330     taskExit();
00331 }
00332 
00333 /****************************************************************************/
00348 void controlTask(void)
00349 {
00350     for(;;)
00351     {
00352 /* Start the measurement task and wait until it reschedules us. */
00353     controlDelayCounter = 0;
00354     measurementTaskID = taskStart((uint16_t)*measurementTask,FALSE);
00355     taskWait();
00356 
00357 /* Float charging - if the voltage is below the threshold, open the panel
00358 to charge, otherwise short the panel until the voltage drops. */
00359     uint16_t floatThreshold = 8847;                      /* Float charge voltage 13.5V */
00360     uint16_t currentBatteryVoltage = scaledChannelValue[1];
00361     if (currentBatteryVoltage < floatThreshold)
00362         openPanel();
00363     else
00364         shortPanel();
00365 
00374     if (eepromEnd - bufferEndPointer > DATA_BLOCK_SIZE)
00375         newBufferEndPointer = bufferEndPointer + DATA_BLOCK_SIZE;
00376     else
00377         newBufferEndPointer = BUFFER_START + DATA_BLOCK_SIZE;
00378 /* If full, move the buffer start pointer along one to allow the new value to
00379 overwrite the oldest value */
00380     if (newBufferEndPointer == bufferStartPointer)
00381     {
00382         if (eepromEnd - bufferStartPointer > DATA_BLOCK_SIZE)
00383             bufferStartPointer += DATA_BLOCK_SIZE;
00384         else
00385             bufferStartPointer = BUFFER_START;
00386     }
00387 /* Now write the new pointers so that data can be recovered from the EEPROM
00388 in the event of a power loss.*/
00389     while (twiErrorStatus() == 0xFF) taskRelinquish();
00390     controlDelayCounter = 2;
00391     taskWait();                         /* Wait for timer ISR */
00392     twiSetupTransaction(0);             /* Write only */
00393     twiWriteByte(0);                    /* Address */
00394     twiWriteByte(0x08);                 /* of pointers */
00395     twiWriteByte(low(bufferStartPointer));
00396     twiWriteByte(high(bufferStartPointer));
00397     twiWriteByte(low(newBufferEndPointer));
00398     twiWriteByte(high(newBufferEndPointer));
00399     twiLaunch(localEEPROMDevice);
00400 
00401 /* Write the conversion time and all relevant data to EEPROM */
00402     while (twiErrorStatus() == 0xFF) taskRelinquish();
00403     controlDelayCounter = 2;
00404     taskWait();                             /* Wait for timer ISR */
00405     twiSetupTransaction(0);                 /* Write only */
00406     twiWriteByte(high(bufferEndPointer));   /* Address */
00407     twiWriteByte(low(bufferEndPointer));
00408     for (uint8_t n = 0; n < 4; ++n)
00409         twiWriteByte(time.timeByte[n]);
00410     for (uint8_t n = 0; n < 4; ++n)         /* Write scaled conversions */
00411     {
00412         twiWriteByte(low(scaledChannelValue[n]));
00413         twiWriteByte(high(scaledChannelValue[n]));
00414     }
00415     twiLaunch(localEEPROMDevice);
00416     bufferEndPointer = newBufferEndPointer;
00417 
00418     controlDelayCounter = 60;
00419     taskWait();
00420     }
00421 }
00422 
00423 /****************************************************************************/
00430 void displayTask(void)
00431 {
00432 /* Multiply, scale back 10 bits and add offset to get a decimal representation.*/
00433 /* Display on LCD Panel */
00434     LCDClear();
00435     LCDWriteString("Panel   = ");
00436     display(scaledChannelValue[0]);
00437     LCDWriteString("V");
00438     LCDGotoXY(0,1);                         /* Next Line */
00439     LCDWriteString("Battery = ");
00440     display(scaledChannelValue[1]);
00441     LCDWriteString("V");
00442     taskExit();
00443 }
00444 
00445 /****************************************************************************/
00460 void processError(void)
00461 {
00462     while (outputBusy) taskRelinquish();
00463     outputCommand = ERROR_COMMAND;
00464     outputBuffer[0] = lastError;
00465     ++numberOutBytes;
00466     lastError = NO_ERROR;
00467     outputPacketSendID = taskStart((uint16_t)*outputPacketSend,FALSE);
00468     taskSchedule(inputPacketReceiveID,FALSE);
00469     taskExit();
00470 }
00471 
00472 /****************************************************************************/
00484 void processCommand(void)
00485 {
00486     while (outputBusy) taskRelinquish();
00487     numberOutBytes = 0;
00488     switch (inputCommand)
00489     {
00490 /*---------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00496         case UNIT_INF_ACCESS:
00497         {
00498             if (numberInBytes != 0) lastError = UNIT_INF_ACCESS_SYNTAX;
00499             else
00500             {
00501                 numberOutBytes = 7;
00502                 outputBuffer[0] = low(INF_BLOCK_START);
00503                 outputBuffer[1] = high(INF_BLOCK_START);
00504                 while (! eeprom_is_ready()) taskRelinquish();
00505                 outputBuffer[2] = eeprom_read_byte(INF_BLOCK_START);
00506                 outputBuffer[3] = DATA_BUFFER_SIZE;
00507                 outputBuffer[4] = 0;    /* This would be the Board ID */
00508                 outputBuffer[5] = low(F_CPU/1000);
00509                 outputBuffer[6] = high(F_CPU/1000);
00510                 outputCommand = SUCCESS_COMMAND;
00511             }
00512         }
00513         break;
00514 /*---------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00520         case READ_MEMORY:
00521         {
00522             if (numberInBytes != 3) lastError = READ_MEMORY_SYNTAX;
00523             else
00524             {
00525                 address = (uint8_t *) (inputBuffer[0] + (inputBuffer[1] << 8));
00526                 eepromCount = inputBuffer[2];
00527                 if (eepromCount > DATA_BUFFER_SIZE)
00528                     eepromCount = DATA_BUFFER_SIZE;
00529                 while (numberOutBytes < eepromCount)
00530                 {
00531                     if (eeprom_is_ready())
00532                     {
00533                         outputBuffer[numberOutBytes] = eeprom_read_byte(address);
00534                         ++numberOutBytes;
00535                         ++address;
00536                     }
00537                     else taskRelinquish();
00538                 }
00539                 outputCommand = SUCCESS_COMMAND;
00540               }
00541         }
00542         break;
00543 /*---------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00549         case WRITE_MEMORY:
00550         {
00551             if ((numberInBytes < 3) || (numberInBytes > DATA_BUFFER_SIZE))
00552                 lastError = WRITE_MEMORY_SYNTAX;
00553             else
00554             {
00555                 uint8_t *address;
00556                 address = (uint8_t *) (inputBuffer[0] + (inputBuffer[1] << 8));
00557                 eepromCount = 2;
00558                 while (eepromCount < numberInBytes)
00559                 {
00560                     if (eeprom_is_ready())
00561                     {
00562                         eeprom_write_byte(address,inputBuffer[eepromCount]);
00563                         ++eepromCount;
00564                         ++address;
00565                     }
00566                     else taskRelinquish();
00567                 }
00568                 outputCommand = SUCCESS_COMMAND; /* command to send back */
00569             }
00570         }
00571         break;
00572 /*---------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00579         case READ_EEPROM:
00580         {
00581             if (numberInBytes != 4) lastError = READ_EEPROM_SYNTAX;
00582             else
00583             {                                   /* wait till not busy */
00584                 while (twiErrorStatus() == 0xFF) taskRelinquish();
00585                 eepromCount = inputBuffer[3];     /* number of bytes */
00586                 twiSetupTransaction(eepromCount); /* Write/Read */
00587                 twiWriteByte(inputBuffer[2]);     /* High address */
00588                 twiWriteByte(inputBuffer[1]);     /* Low address */
00589                 if (eepromCount > DATA_BUFFER_SIZE)
00590                     eepromCount = DATA_BUFFER_SIZE;
00591 /* Try to launch the read. If there is a problem, drop out */
00592                 if(twiLaunch(inputBuffer[0]))    /* device ID */
00593                 {
00594 /* The twiCompletionStatus shows if the transaction is busy and also how many
00595 bytes were read if an aborted transaction occurred. First wait until not busy.*/
00596                     while (twiCompletionStatus() == 0xFF) taskRelinquish();
00597                     uint8_t completionStatus = twiCompletionStatus();
00598                     {
00599                         uint8_t numberRead = eepromCount;
00600                         if (completionStatus != 0) numberRead = (completionStatus & 0x3F);
00601                         for (;numberRead > 0; --numberRead)
00602                         {
00603                             outputBuffer[numberOutBytes] = twiReadByte();
00604                             ++numberOutBytes;
00605                         }
00606                         if ((twiErrorStatus() == 0) && (completionStatus == 0))
00607                             outputCommand = SUCCESS_COMMAND; /* command to send back */
00608                         else
00609                             lastError = READ_EEPROM_FAIL;
00610                     }
00611                 }
00612                 else
00613                     lastError = READ_EEPROM_FAIL;
00614                 if (lastError == READ_EEPROM_FAIL)
00615                 {
00616                     outputBuffer[1] = twiErrorStatus();
00617                     outputBuffer[2] = twiCompletionStatus();
00618                     numberOutBytes = 2;
00619                 }
00620             }
00621         }
00622         break;
00623 /*---------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00629         case WRITE_EEPROM:
00630         {
00631           if ((numberInBytes < 4) || (numberInBytes > DATA_BUFFER_SIZE))
00632             lastError = WRITE_EEPROM_SYNTAX;
00633           else
00634           {
00635             while (twiErrorStatus() == 0xFF) taskRelinquish();
00636             eepromCount = 3;                /* count of data bytes */
00637             twiSetupTransaction(0);         /* Write only */
00638             twiWriteByte(inputBuffer[2]);   /* High address */
00639             twiWriteByte(inputBuffer[1]);   /* Low address */
00640             while(eepromCount < numberInBytes)
00641             {
00642               if (! twiWriteByte(inputBuffer[eepromCount])) break;
00643               ++eepromCount;
00644             }
00645 /* Try to launch the write. If there is a problem, drop out */
00646             if (twiLaunch(inputBuffer[0]))  /* device number */
00647             {
00648               while (twiErrorStatus() == 0xFF) taskRelinquish();
00649               uint8_t lastTwiError = twiErrorStatus();
00650               if (lastTwiError == 0)
00651                 outputCommand = SUCCESS_COMMAND; /* command to send back */
00652               else
00653                 lastError = WRITE_EEPROM_FAIL;
00654             }
00655             else
00656               lastError = WRITE_EEPROM_FAIL;
00657             if (lastError == WRITE_EEPROM_FAIL)
00658             {
00659               outputBuffer[1] = twiErrorStatus();
00660               outputBuffer[2] = twiCompletionStatus();
00661               numberOutBytes = 2;
00662             }
00663           }
00664         }
00665         break;
00666 /*---------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00672         case ADC_ONCE:
00673         {
00674             numberOutBytes = 1;
00675             if (numberInBytes != 2) lastError = ADC_SYNTAX;
00676             else
00677             {
00678                 adcChannel = inputBuffer[0];
00679                 uint8_t adcGain = inputBuffer[1];/* For this application, this is a dummy */
00680                 uint8_t adcStatus = adcStart(1 << adcChannel); /* Start Conversion */
00681                 if (! adcStatus)                /* Check if the start was successful*/
00682                 {
00683                     lastError = ADC_FAILURE;
00684                     outputBuffer[1] = adcStatus;
00685                 }
00686                 else
00687                 {
00688                     while (adcIsBusy()) taskRelinquish(); /* Wait for conversion to end */
00689                     outputBuffer[0] = timer0Read(); /* Timer current value */
00690                     for (uint8_t n=0;n<3;++n)
00691                     {
00692                         outputBuffer[numberOutBytes++] = time.timeByte[n];
00693                     }
00694                     int adcValue = adcRead(adcChannel);
00695                     outputBuffer[numberOutBytes++] = low(adcValue);
00696                     outputBuffer[numberOutBytes++] = high(adcValue);
00697                     outputCommand = SUCCESS_COMMAND; /* command to send back */
00698                 }
00699             }
00700         }
00701         break;
00702 /*---------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00710         case STATE_VARIABLES:
00711         {
00712             if ((numberInBytes != 1) || (inputBuffer[0] != 0)) lastError = STATE_VARIABLE_SYNTAX;
00713             else
00714             {
00715                 for (uint8_t channel = 0; channel < 4; channel++)
00716                 {
00717                     outputBuffer[numberOutBytes++] = low(channelValue[channel]);
00718                     outputBuffer[numberOutBytes++] = high(channelValue[channel]);
00719                 }
00720                 outputCommand = SUCCESS_COMMAND;
00721             }
00722         }
00723         break;
00724 /*---------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00734         case RESET_BUFFER_POINTERS:
00735         {
00736             if (numberInBytes != 0) lastError = RESET_BUFFER_POINTERS_SYNTAX;
00737             else
00738             {
00739                 numberOutBytes = 4;
00740                 outputBuffer[0] = low(bufferStartPointer);
00741                 outputBuffer[1] = high(bufferStartPointer);
00742                 outputBuffer[2] = low(bufferEndPointer);
00743                 outputBuffer[3] = high(bufferEndPointer);
00744                 bufferStartPointer = bufferEndPointer;
00745                 outputCommand = SUCCESS_COMMAND; /* command to send back */
00746             }
00747         }
00748         break;
00749 /*---------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00753         case RESET_CLOCK:
00754         {
00755             if (numberInBytes != 0) lastError = RESET_CLOCK_SYNTAX;
00756             else
00757             {
00758                 time.timeValue = 0;
00759                 timer0Init(0,rtcScale);
00760                 outputCommand = SUCCESS_COMMAND; /* command to send back */
00761             }
00762         }
00763         break;
00764 /*---------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00773         case BOOTLOADER_JUMP:
00774         {
00775           if (numberInBytes != 0) lastError = BOOT_SYNTAX;
00776           else
00777           {
00778             MCUSR = 0;
00779             WDTCSR = (1 << WDCE) | (1 << WDE);
00780             WDTCSR = (1 << WDE);
00781             outputCommand = SUCCESS_COMMAND; /* command to send back */
00782           }
00783         }
00784         break;
00785 #ifdef CORE_DEBUG
00786 /*---------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00792         case READ_SRAM:
00793         {
00794           if (numberInBytes != 3) lastError = READ_SRAM_SYNTAX;
00795           else
00796           {
00797             address =(uint8_t *) (inputBuffer[0] + (inputBuffer[1] << 8));
00798             uint8_t count = inputBuffer[2];
00799             if (count > DATA_BUFFER_SIZE)
00800               count = DATA_BUFFER_SIZE;
00801             while (numberOutBytes < count)
00802             {
00803               outputBuffer[numberOutBytes] = *address;
00804               ++numberOutBytes;
00805               ++address;
00806             }
00807             outputCommand = SUCCESS_COMMAND; /* command to send back */
00808           }
00809         }
00810         break;
00811 /* End of CORE_DEBUG section */
00812 #endif
00813 #ifdef DEBUG
00814 /*---------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00822         case SET_PORT_BIT:
00823         {
00824           if (numberInBytes != 1) lastError = READ_PORT_SYNTAX;
00825           else
00826           {
00827             uint8_t portBit = inputBuffer[0];
00828             uint8_t port = portBit & 0x0F;
00829             uint8_t bit = portBit >> 4;
00830             if (bit > 7) port = portBit;  /* fudge - drop through to default */
00831             switch (port)
00832             {
00833 #if defined PORTA
00834             case 0x0a: sbi(PORTA,bit); break;
00835 #endif
00836 #if defined PORTB
00837             case 0x0b: sbi(PORTB,bit); break;
00838 #endif
00839 #if defined PORTC
00840             case 0x0c: sbi(PORTC,bit); break;
00841 #endif
00842 #if defined PORTD
00843             case 0x0d: sbi(PORTD,bit); break;
00844 #endif
00845 #if defined PORTE
00846             case 0x0e: sbi(PORTE,bit); break;
00847 #endif
00848 #if defined PORTF
00849             case 0x0f: sbi(PORTF,bit); break;
00850 #endif
00851             default:
00852               lastError = NO_PORT;
00853               numberOutBytes = 1;
00854               outputBuffer[1] = portBit;
00855               break;
00856             }
00857             if (lastError == NO_ERROR)
00858               outputCommand = SUCCESS_COMMAND; /* command to send back */
00859           }
00860         }
00861         break;
00862 /*---------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00870     case CLEAR_PORT_BIT:
00871     {
00872       if (numberInBytes != 1) lastError = READ_PORT_SYNTAX;
00873       else
00874       {
00875         uint8_t portBit = inputBuffer[0];
00876         uint8_t port = portBit & 0x0F;
00877         uint8_t bit = portBit >> 4;
00878         if (bit > 7) port = portBit;  /* fudge - drop through to default */
00879         switch (port)
00880         {
00881 #if defined PORTA
00882         case 0x0a: cbi(PORTA,bit); break;
00883 #endif
00884 #if defined PORTB
00885         case 0x0b: cbi(PORTB,bit); break;
00886 #endif
00887 #if defined PORTC
00888         case 0x0c: cbi(PORTC,bit); break;
00889 #endif
00890 #if defined PORTD
00891         case 0x0d: cbi(PORTD,bit); break;
00892 #endif
00893 #if defined PORTE
00894         case 0x0e: cbi(PORTE,bit); break;
00895 #endif
00896 #if defined PORTF
00897         case 0x0f: cbi(PORTF,bit); break;
00898 #endif
00899         default:
00900           lastError = NO_PORT;
00901           numberOutBytes = 1;
00902           outputBuffer[1] = portBit;
00903           break;
00904         }
00905         if (lastError == NO_ERROR)
00906           outputCommand = SUCCESS_COMMAND; /* command to send back */
00907       }
00908     }
00909     break;
00910 /*---------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00915     case READ_PORT:
00916     {
00917       if (numberInBytes != 1) lastError = READ_PORT_SYNTAX;
00918       else
00919       {
00920         uint8_t port = inputBuffer[0];
00921         uint8_t portContents = 0;
00922         numberOutBytes = 1;
00923         switch (port)
00924         {
00925 #if defined PINA
00926         case 0x0a: portContents = inb(PINA); break;
00927 #endif
00928 #if defined PINB
00929         case 0x0b: portContents = inb(PINB); break;
00930 #endif
00931 #if defined PINC
00932         case 0x0c: portContents = inb(PINC); break;
00933 #endif
00934 #if defined PIND
00935         case 0x0d: portContents = inb(PIND); break;
00936 #endif
00937 #if defined PINE
00938         case 0x0e: portContents = inb(PINE); break;
00939 #endif
00940 #if defined PINF
00941         case 0x0f: portContents = inb(PINF); break;
00942 #endif
00943         default:
00944           lastError = NO_PORT;
00945           outputBuffer[1] = port;
00946           break;
00947         }
00948         if (lastError == NO_ERROR)
00949         {
00950           outputBuffer[0] = portContents;
00951           outputCommand = SUCCESS_COMMAND; /* command to send back */
00952         }
00953       }
00954     }
00955     break;
00956 /*---------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00957 /* End of DEBUG section */
00958 #endif
00959 
00962     default:
00963       lastError = UNKNOWN_COMMAND;
00964     break;
00965   }
00968   if (lastError == NO_ERROR)
00969     outputPacketSendID = taskStart((uint16_t)*outputPacketSend,FALSE);
00970   else
00971     outputPacketSendID = taskStart((uint16_t)*processError,FALSE);
00972   taskSchedule(inputPacketReceiveID,FALSE);
00973   taskExit();
00974 }
00975 
00976 /****************************************************************************/
00999 void inputPacketReceive(void)
01000 {
01001   for(;;)
01002   {
01003     uartInput = uart_getc();  /* upper byte has an error code, if any */
01004     if (high(uartInput) != 0) /* nonzero if error or no character received */
01005       taskRelinquish();
01006     else
01007     {
01008       uint8_t newCharacter = (uint8_t) uartInput & 0xFF;  /* lower byte */
01009       switch (packetInState)
01010       {
01016       case IDLE:                  /* loop until an idle char is received */
01017         if (newCharacter == IDLE_CHAR)
01018         {                         /* get here with a valid IDLE received */
01019           if (! outputBusy) uart_putc(IDLE_CHAR);  /* ping PC */
01020           packetInState = SYNC;   /* look for a sync character */
01021         }
01022         break;
01026       case SYNC:
01027         if (newCharacter == SYNC_CHAR) packetInState = ADDRESS;
01028         else if (newCharacter != IDLE_CHAR) packetInState =IDLE;
01029         else if (! outputBusy) uart_putc(IDLE_CHAR);  /* ping PC */
01030         break;
01034       case ADDRESS:
01035         packetInState = NUMBER_BYTES;
01036         break;
01039       case NUMBER_BYTES:
01040         numberInBytes = newCharacter;
01041         dataInByteCount = 0;      /* counter for data phase */
01042         if (numberInBytes == 0) packetInState = CHECKSUM;
01043         else packetInState = COMMAND;
01044         break;
01047       case COMMAND:
01048         inputCommand = newCharacter;
01049         if (--numberInBytes == 0) packetInState = CHECKSUM;
01050         else packetInState = DATA_PHASE;
01051         break;
01054       case DATA_PHASE:
01055         if (dataInByteCount < DATA_BUFFER_SIZE)
01056         {
01057           inputBuffer[dataInByteCount] = newCharacter;
01058         }
01059         if (++dataInByteCount == numberInBytes) packetInState = CHECKSUM;
01060         break;
01062       case CHECKSUM:
01063         packetInState = EOM;
01064         break;
01068       case EOM:
01069         packetInState = IDLE;
01070         if (newCharacter != EOM_CHAR)
01071         {
01072           lastError = COMMAND_SYNTAX;
01073           outputBuffer[1] = newCharacter;
01074           numberOutBytes = 1;
01075           processErrorID = taskStart((uint16_t)*processError,FALSE);
01076         }
01077         else
01078           processCommandID = taskStart((uint16_t)*processCommand,FALSE);
01079         taskWait();
01080         break;
01081       }
01082     }
01083   }
01084 }
01085 
01086 /****************************************************************************/
01098 void outputPacketSend(void)
01099 {
01100   outputBusy = TRUE;
01101   for(;;)         // Loop "indefinitely" but will exit when finished
01102   {
01103     if (! uart_output_free()) taskRelinquish();
01104     else
01105     {
01106       switch (packetOutState)
01107       {
01108       case IDLE:
01109         uart_putc(IDLE_CHAR);
01110         packetOutState = SYNC;
01111         break;
01112       case SYNC:
01113         uart_putc(SYNC_CHAR);
01114         packetOutState = ADDRESS;
01115         checkSum = 0;
01116         break;
01117       case ADDRESS:
01118         uart_putc(0x0);             /* Address is PC, packet type 0 */
01119         packetOutState = NUMBER_BYTES;
01120         break;
01121       case NUMBER_BYTES:
01122         uart_putc(numberOutBytes+1);
01123         checkSum += numberOutBytes+1;
01124         packetOutState = COMMAND;
01125         break;
01126       case COMMAND:
01127         uart_putc(outputCommand);
01128         checkSum += outputCommand;
01129         dataOutByteCount = 0;
01130         packetOutState = DATA_PHASE;
01131         break;
01132       case DATA_PHASE:
01133         if (numberOutBytes-- > 0)
01134         {
01135           uart_putc(outputBuffer[dataOutByteCount]);
01136           checkSum += outputBuffer[dataOutByteCount];
01137           ++dataOutByteCount;
01138         }
01139         else packetOutState = CHECKSUM;
01140         break;
01141       case CHECKSUM:
01142         uart_putc(checkSum);
01143         packetOutState = EOM;
01144         break;
01145       case EOM:
01146         uart_putc(EOM_CHAR);
01147         packetOutState = IDLE;
01148         outputCommand = NO_COMMAND;
01149         numberOutBytes = 0;
01150         outputBusy = FALSE;
01151         taskExit();
01152         break;
01153       }
01154     }
01155   }
01156 }
01157 
01158 /****************************************************************************/
01169 ISR(SIG_OVERFLOW0)
01170 {
01171     time.timeValue++;
01172 /* This counter is used to restart a task at precisely timed intervals.
01173 Set the counter just before starting the task for the first time, then
01174 issue a taskExit at the end of the task. The task should complete well
01175 before the time interval is finished */
01176     if ((displayTaskCounter > 0) && (--displayTaskCounter == 0))
01177     {
01178         displayTaskCounter = displayInterval;   /* Reset counter for next cycle*/
01179         displayTaskID = taskStart((uint16_t)*displayTask,TRUE);
01180     }
01181 //    if ((controlTaskCounter > 0) && (--controlTaskCounter == 0))
01182     {
01183 //        controlTaskCounter = controlInterval;   /* Reset counter for next cycle*/
01184 //        controlTaskID = taskStart((uint16_t)*controlTask,TRUE);
01185     }
01186 //    if ((measurementTaskCounter > 0) && (--measurementTaskCounter == 0))
01187     {
01188 //        measurementTaskCounter = measurementInterval;   /* Reset counter for next cycle*/
01189 //        measurementTaskID = taskStart((uint16_t)*measurementTask,TRUE);
01190     }
01191 /* This counter is used within the task to enter a timed wait state.
01192 Set the counter just before the taskWait command. */
01193     if ((controlDelayCounter > 0) && (--controlDelayCounter == 0))
01194     {
01195         taskSchedule(controlTaskID,TRUE);
01196     }
01197 }
01198 
01199 /****************************************************************************/
01208 long rescale(const int quantity,const int multiplier,const int offset)
01209 {
01210     uint16_t q = quantity;
01211     if (quantity < 0) q = -quantity;
01212     uint16_t m = multiplier;
01213     if (multiplier < 0) m = -multiplier;
01214     uint16_t o = offset;
01215     if (offset < 0) o = -offset;
01216     uint8_t lowVoltage = low(q);
01217     uint8_t highVoltage = high(q);
01218     uint8_t lowMultiplier = low(m);
01219     uint8_t highMultiplier = high(m);
01220     uint16_t first = lowVoltage*lowMultiplier;
01221     uint16_t second = lowVoltage*highMultiplier+ highVoltage*lowMultiplier;
01222     uint16_t third = highVoltage*highMultiplier;
01223     int product = ((high(first) + second) >> 2) + (third << 6);
01224     if (((quantity>0) && (multiplier<0)) || ((quantity<0) && (multiplier>0))) product = -product;
01225     if (offset>0) return product+o;
01226     else return product-o;
01227 }
01228 /****************************************************************************/
01237 void display(const long value)
01238 {
01239     uint32_t v = value;
01240     if (value < 0)
01241     {
01242         v = -value;
01243         LCDByte(1,'-');
01244     }
01245     uint8_t precision = 4;
01246     for (uint8_t n = 0; n<precision; n++)
01247     {
01248         uint32_t x = v*10;
01249         uint8_t digit = (x >> 16);
01250         v = x - ((uint32_t)digit << 16);
01251         if ((n > 0) || (digit > 0)) LCDByte(1,digit+48);
01252         if (n == 1) LCDByte(1,'.');
01253     }
01254 }
01255 
01256 /****************************************************************************/
01264 void setErrorCode(const unsigned int code)
01265 {
01266     if (code == 0)
01267         offLED();
01268     else
01269     {
01270         onLED();
01271         LCDClear();
01272         LCDWriteString("Error Code: ");
01273         LCDWriteHexWord((unsigned int)code,0);
01274     }
01275 }
01276 
01277 /****************************************************************************/
01284 /****************************************************************************/
01296 void configurePorts(void)
01297 {
01298 /* Set PortD DDR bits 2-7 to outputs for LCD. Bits 0,1 are the USART ports */
01299     outb(DDRD,(inb(DDRD) | 0xFC));
01300 /* Set PORTB as outputs on bits 0-2 to set controls */
01301     outb(DDRB,(inb(DDRB) | 0x07));
01302 /* Set all four ADC port pins (analogue inputs) as inputs */
01303     outb(DDRC,(inb(DDRC) & 0xF0));
01304     outb(PRR,0x4D);                   /* power down unused peripherals */
01305     sbi(ACSR,7);                      /* Turn off Analogue Comparator */
01306 }
01307 /****************************************************************************/
01311 void openPanel(void)
01312 {
01313     sbi(PORTB,0);                     // Panel is not shorted
01314 }
01315 /****************************************************************************/
01319 void shortPanel(void)
01320 {
01321     cbi(PORTB,0);                     // Panel is shorted
01322 }
01323 /****************************************************************************/
01327 void connectLoad(void)
01328 {
01329     cbi(PORTB,1);                     // Load is connected
01330 }
01331 /****************************************************************************/
01335 void isolateLoad(void)
01336 {
01337     sbi(PORTB,1);                     // Load is connected
01338 }
01339 /****************************************************************************/
01343 void onLED(void)
01344 {
01345     cbi(PORTB,2);                     // Load is connected
01346 }
01347 /****************************************************************************/
01351 void offLED(void)
01352 {
01353     sbi(PORTB,2);                     // Load is connected
01354 }
